website_summaries.verdict: This attractive Moka pot not only looks stunning but performs excellently, too.
pros: Suitable for use on all stovetops, including induction
cons: A tiny number of users had issues with leaks

customer_reviews.title: "Copper" film came off after 2 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product. First disappointment was that I wanted an all stainless Steel which was my previous coffee maker for 15 years. The part which holds the coffee is aluminum. The main problem that the "Cooper Chrome Finish" is not that. It seems to be just a colored plastic film which came off after 2 uses. Beautiful but not usable.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K

customer_reviews.title: Pricey and copper last short
customer_reviews.text: It’s stylish and for me makes two cups of coffee. So far no leaks as others reviewers said. Update 8/16/19: the top part, copper, started peeling off and it looks awful. It’s no longer attractive in the kitchen. For the price I thought it should last longer. Also the handle gets very hot and most of the time I need a reg to avoid burning my hand
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Lacerda

customer_reviews.title: Very poor craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with high hopes after reading reviews, but it was a huge disappointment. First of all, the copper colored top is not copper or even plated with copper. It's some kind of weird sticker that flakes away when you hand wash it. This made it look like junk after the first use. Afterwards it continued to get worse. It does make espresso properly, but for something so expensive, it's really a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: I am glad I bought it! I was thinking it was too expensive for the coffee maker but I’m glad I decide to buy this. I bought couple month ago espreso maker for $13 which was working just fine but I didn’t really liked quality. It was made with cheap aluminum. That was the main reason paid almost triple and wanted to see if the quality was different and YES it is. Easy to clean, works perfect with out mess and looks great! That’s all I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed by the qiality
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy when I received the espresso maker but the copper chrome finish has started to peel off before the end of the month. Now the copper upper part is half copper half stainless steel. So disappointing because it was matching my kitchen interior perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Elitsa Aleksieva

customer_reviews.title: The stainless steel heats up the water much better than aluminum
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 3 stovetop espresso makers, but the bonVIVO earns the gold. The stainless steel heats up the water much better than aluminum. I’ve noticed that the coffee remains hotter for longer. The chrome finish adds elegance to any kitchen. The downside: parts of the handle get extremely hot, so be very weary because there is no plastic.
customer_reviews.author: CAdiver

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: First I thought it was a leaky seal but it looks like the pressure release valve is faulty.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality, Well Made !!!
customer_reviews.text: Recently, I had a guest from Italy over at the house. She had a stovetop expresso maker. The aroma and taste was far superior to my Mr. Coffee maker. After reading many reviews on various stovetop expresso makers, I decided to go with the bonVIVO Intenca. Product weight was more than similar 5-6 cup models. I figured that more weight means more stainless steel and better quality. I am completely satisfied with this unit. I use less coffee beans now and get 1-1/2 times more to savor in the morning! The aroma reminds me of my grandmother's house from years ago. The Intenca makes the best coffee I've had, Period.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C.

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BE WARE
customer_reviews.text: this item broke....and it was not dropped...just broke while making coffee on the stove...
customer_reviews.author: Ray Perry, this book is a must read. Excellent philosophy and brilliant logics. Mrs Poem is super

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works great. It being made of stainless steel is important. Coffee is acidic and the aluminum units brew espresso tainted with aluminum which may be problematic.
customer_reviews.author: Rumplestiltskin

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought the all-stainless steel version of the Intenca. I am very pleased with it so far - pleasing aesthetics, good quality materials and most importantly, it produces a great cup of coffee. My only slight reservations are that the lid mechanism feels a little flimsy, and also that when the top half of the percolator is screwed on to the bottom there is a disconcerting gap left between the two. This has no bearing on the functionality of the coffee maker, however. If you want a good cup of coffee but can't be bothered with fancy gadgets and machines, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: needbe

customer_reviews.title: Not for the price
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this could be great but something about how it’s made doesn’t quite work. Water is always coming out of the middle part where the bottom screws in and my coffee taste burnt 9/10 times. For the money I expected something better but quality of coffee is the same as a ten dollar one.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Valenziano

customer_reviews.title: Severe issues
customer_reviews.text: There was rust inside. How is this possible with stainless steel and for a new item? The item does not make espressos at all as advertised, just watery coffee. Lid is severely offset from center as if it is a knock-off. Severe disappointed for something I paid $54 for.
customer_reviews.author: Enthusiastic coffee drinker

customer_reviews.title: great on induction stovetop.  Really only 2 cups
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting great tasting results with this. On the induction stovetop it takes less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: LITTLE cID

customer_reviews.title: Half the water stays in the bottom chamber, continuously boiling...
customer_reviews.text: We bought the 3-4 cup version to replace our old aluminum stovetop coffee maker that broke. But things were easy then - the water boiled completely to the top, and we knew exactly when coffee was ready! This one just...fills up half the chamber and keeps boiling. Like there's some design issue with the filtering pipe. So we get 1 cup of old coffee that stayed there at the top for too long, and 2 cups of clean boiled water in the bottom chamber...
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer Gentleman

customer_reviews.title: Very good low-end espresso maker. Beware hot handle!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it a week but I can confirm its much nicer than the aluminum ones which leech metal into the water/coffee, interfering with taste (and our health, Google it). Worth the extra cost if you can. Don't expect espresso quality, that requires machines well over $100. But this makes good quality coffee. I've had no problem with leaking that other reviewers mention. *Downside: the handle gets very hot, don't even think about bypassing the hot pad or something to protect your fingers: seriously!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: 100% Steel
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find this one is indeed 100% steel. I've ordered others in the past that have steel on the outside, but the inner basin was some other metal (likely aluminum). The basin seems to be one solid piece and not lined with some other metal. It works great! I've included pics of the inside so that you may judge for yourself. One thing to note, this is not an espresso machine that has high pressure, so ultra fine grain can clog the pours and make it so that the steam does not push through to the top. Be sure to use slightly less than fine grain and you will very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Usc

customer_reviews.title: great until I saw rust
customer_reviews.text: I needed a moka machine that would: - be induction ready - not be made out of aluminum - not rust - be sturdy - be easy to clean, if possible I spent a lot of time looking for the perfect fit and ordered this moka machine in September 2018. I was extremely satisfied. I use it regularly (about twice a week). I rinse it with water only and let it air dry. I was bumped when I discovered a tiny rusty spot at the bottom of the pot and cannot understand where it would come from. I read that cleaning it with baking soda and water can remove the spot and will try that. Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: minieme

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Rusted after about a month of use. Couldn’t return it after 30days.
customer_reviews.author: Aunya

customer_reviews.title: Speedy!  Great for induction cooktop!
customer_reviews.text: After visiting Rome a year ago, my husband searched for an Italian espresso maker that would work with our induction cooktop. This product is what he found, and I am impressed!! The coffee is finished in less than a minute, it tastes just like the traditional Italian espresso, it is a sturdy stainless-steel product, and clean up is a breeze. I'm most impressed with how well-made this product is. It is hefty, smooth, easy to screw & unscrew, and all that I would expect and then some.
customer_reviews.author: becolorado

customer_reviews.title: Works well with induction plate
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement for an aeropress that had worn out. I have a small induction plate, 1800W duxtop, that I wanted to be able to use. Nice constructions, seems like good materials. It's unclear where it's actually manufactured, the box had contact information in Germany. The seal between the lower chamber and the upper pot could be better, as it requires a fair bit of force to snug things down such that they don't leak steam. Enough so that my wife will probably not be able to use it without me there to snug it down. Beyond that it works very well, and I'm pleased with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian Tillier

customer_reviews.title: Works Well on GE Induction Range
customer_reviews.text: It took quite a while for me to find an induction stovetop espresso maker. Our old Bialetti, which we've had for years, would not work, of course. The when I found the correct models/materials to use on our induction range, it was almost impossible to find one large enough in diameter to use on our smallest burner. On our GE cooktop, the smallest burner requires a 4-1/2" pan in order to activate it, according to the manual. While the bonVivo is not quite that large, it still works. The coffee is as I expected, and I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jmpm

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Durable Stainless Steel Moka Pot
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty espresso maker that makes delicious coffee. It's very easy to clean and has a nice design. The only thing I've noticed so far is that there always seems to be some water at the bottom that doesn't make it up to the upper part of the maker. I bought it because I read that using aluminum for cooking wasn't good for your health. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Muriel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality SS espresso maker-makes easy great espresso
customer_reviews.text: 3 yrs ago, invested in expensive espresso machine that worked great for 2 yrs & then developed all kinds of problems. After expensive repairs & replacement of parts, it still did not function correctly. Decided to NOT spend any more $ on it. After hrs of reading reviews, decided to go easy & simple & decided to try BonVivo's Italian stove-top espresso maker. It's been GREAT! Makes espresso that rivals the espresso made by our $800 espresso maker! The only down side: it's not real easy to clean the espresso stains left in the brew chamber & it requires a brush to be able to clean the parts well. But overall a GREAT espresso maker for very little $$.
customer_reviews.author: zephyr

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful - but rots out quick
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful Italian pot but I doubt it's the real deal. Within a few months the bottom of the pot (inside where the coffee ends up being) peeled. It continued to peel and turn black, like a tarnished metal. At that point it didn't seem healthy to drink coffee coming out of that pot. I imagine particles, however micro, were ending up in my coffee. Also, it became harder and harder to screw open the top part of the expresso maker from the bottom. I wanted something well made and authentic. This wasn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger.NYC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality !
customer_reviews.text: I have been desperately searching for an expresso maker & thankfully found bonVIVO. Excellent quality & easy to use! I use Bustelo & it makes an amazing cup of coffee. So happy for this purchase!! This will also make the perfect Christmas gift for all those coffee lovers. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Copper peels off with little use!!
customer_reviews.text: Beauty is only skin deep with this little pot. What a giant waste of $50!! My husband and I bought this last year as a little 22nd (copper) anniversary gift to ourselves. We used it a handful of times before settling it aside in favor of our old moka pot that was faster and made more coffee that wasn’t watery. I just dug it out of its box for a final cleanup before putting it up for sale. After HAND WASHING and letting it dry, THIS is what happened! The copper peeled off like a cheap plastic decal. I am so disappointed. We barely even used it. I will not be buying from this company again. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE - it's what makes the coffee of this "moka" (or is it?)
customer_reviews.text: Love this "moka" as call them the Italians. It doesnt build up oxide (as do the traditional aluminum ones, like the 6 sided Bialetti) and somehow has a flavor and texture that is different from two other, similar looking, stainless steel brewers that i own. I LOVE IT ! and I like the color, which so far has been remarkably easy to keep glossy with light sponge and dish soap (I don't use a dishwasher so not sure how the finish holds under these corrosive conditions).
customer_reviews.author: AlchemistOfLife

customer_reviews.title: Best Moka Pot
customer_reviews.text: I fell in love with moka style stove-top espresso last year and have purchased several pots since then of varying types and qualities. This one is by FAR the best -- heavy, sturdy, and the stainless stays shiny and doesn't get that dull pot metal look. I t's also really pretty AND best of all makes an excellent cup of coffee (or two cups for this size). UPDATE: I liked this so much that I purchased the smaller size. The larger one is still just as shiny and gorgeous and good-working as when I first bought it. The smaller one makes a generous "single" serving for a large cup of coffee (or two small cups).
customer_reviews.author: Jen Ford

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Nice Brewing
customer_reviews.text: Nice coffee maker. Happy I purchased the Chrome. Love the long upper part feature which avoids splashing of coffee all over the stove when I open it to check the brewing. What a difference from the aluminum pots that I have used all my life. Also like the design that leaves a small space when you put the 2 pieces together. I had so much difficulty with my other brand and ended up tightening it so much that I spilled coffee crumbs all over the counter trying to open it.
customer_reviews.author: AGLEZ

customer_reviews.title: Works great but handle gets hot.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Feels sturdy and has a good weight to it. The handle gets hot hot! Which is why I only gave it 3 stars. I've never had a moka pot where that has happened.
customer_reviews.author: W.D.

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel is important to me
customer_reviews.text: I love Cuban coffee, but don't like to use aluminum to cook with. So, after my second electric cappucino maker broke, I decided to go old school and get a stove top maker. I insisted on stainless and I love the quality and the results I get. I also purchased a hand frother so I am not missing out on anything. This is a sturdy espresso maker and you'll be doing yourself a favor if the lights ever go out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Vaccaro

customer_reviews.title: Great espresso maker
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a replacement for an aluminum version, while it produced a good cup, it was nowhere as good as the bonVIVO. I have about nine pots through it and it's real simple, takes about 9 minutes to make, the materials are far more superior and it looks great! I have a feeling this will last a long while,if something happens to it I would absolutely order the same one. Quit pondering the reviews and click add to cart, you will not regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: crob651

customer_reviews.title: Great for one person cups. Good coffee but get the stainless steel version only. Not painted.
customer_reviews.text: Makes good coffee but gets very dirty inside fast. If you fill the bottom too much your coffee tends to get watered down so its better to cut back on water for the best quadruple espresso. After 3 months the lid lost its swivel bar piece and fell off so not 100 percent well made. And since it is made in China, the copper finish will be all scratched up after a few usages. I have to throw it out after a few months. I’m probably drinking the chipped off paint.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: Easier to use than expected
customer_reviews.text: I had been curious for years about stove top espresso makers (technically, these make "moka" and not espresso coffee), though was wary about the process. But these are quite simple to use, and to clean, and the bonVivo model is very stylish and solid. I will have to experiment a bit more with different roasts and grinds before I can speak fully about the taste, yet so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Vilebodies

customer_reviews.title: this thing is a coffee tank!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I use it every day 1 to 3 times a day. Only reason I had to buy a new one is because I habitually left it on the stove past its completion poit on high for over two years. Eventually the pressure button on the bottom popped. It was 100% my fault. Had I taken it off the stove when it was done im sure it would have lasted my 5 or more. You barely have to clean the normal parts you slave over in other makers. Ill keep buying this thing as long as I drink coffee. I need nothing more!
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher Burch

customer_reviews.title: All stainless steel, expertly made, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Very well made moka pot with all stainless construction. The stainless steel handle is smoothly and securely soldered to the pot and stays cool to the touch. The lid hinge is also securely soldered. The base is heavy with a brass safety valve and threads perfectly into the pot. The filter basket is also stainless steel. I found this moka pot to make a rich espresso with a very fine crema. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: F

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker Yet!
customer_reviews.text: Update to my initial review: Easy to clean with the right equipment, durable, higher quality stainless and silicone parts, and makes GREAT coffee - espresso style - my favorite. Small yet significant Design flaw: I still think they ought to lengthen the stem on the uppermost area where you open the lid of the coffeemaker to see if it's done, so there is less likelihood of getting burnt.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Stylish, quality build, but tough to clean
customer_reviews.text: Stylish and looks the Italian part! The tall percolating chamber almost prevents the coffee from splattering everywhere on the stove. The one big problem is the bottom of the chamber is darn near impossible to clean. It has a deep, circumferential groove that cannot he reached by sponge or hand due to the percolating shaft. Maybe a pipe cleaner long cue tip?
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this product! It's easy to clean, works really well and the espresso is divine! If it didn't take a bit to prepare, I would be having this four times in the morning! It says it is a 6-cup capacity, but there isn't enough room for all the espresso powder for 6 cups. It makes maybe three small servings (1-ounce, maybe), then you have to add more water and reuse the grounds for another round.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a non-aluminum stove-top coffeemaker for a while after we decided to go away from aluminum in cooking and switching to the induction stove. Previously we were big fans of one Italian brand however their quality for stainless steel devices dropped comparing to original products. After trying several different brands we got the bonVIVO device. So far I'm satisfied, the product looks and feels solid and reliable, performs as expected. Doesn't spill anything no matter how fast you pour. Can't say anything about the quality of the resulting coffee as it is quite the same as every other machine brew. I would recommend it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor M. Pishchulin

customer_reviews.title: Nice coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to have a pot just large enough for a morning cup for my wife and I. Two things though: It's not clear how to replace the seal should it wear out. The other thing is don't put it in the dishwasher. I believe the instructions probably say that but I forgot. After only one time it took about a third of the copper finish off the outside but in an ugly peeling way. After that the only option is to live with it or keep putting it in the dishwasher to remove the rest, which I'm doing.
customer_reviews.author: RichGun

customer_reviews.title: Health Hazard
customer_reviews.text: Bottom cup rusted after 3 weeks of use. Low quality steel. Health hazard!
customer_reviews.author: Behnam

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. It’s pretty 2. Appears solidly constructed 3. Clear directions 4. Arrived quickly Cons: 1. Doesn’t work 2. Handle gets a bit hot during use I’m returning. Pictures attached to show attractive design and what I got for “coffee” when using it. If only hot air tasted as good as espresso. But then I still wouldn’t need this. 🤷‍♀️ Hope you get a working one.
customer_reviews.author: Caprice Adair

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews and respect manufacturers and people's business. But in this case, in a product that is marketed as high-end, I will and inform the public. The water doesn't percolate upwards and no coffee is delivered. I have used espresso makers for years and use finely ground Lavazza coffee and not home-ground. The pot heats up and steams but no coffee delivered. This is hazardous with excessive heating and the potential risk involved. For a higher-end product, one would expect a good quality control before marketing to the public. What a shame and disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: U

customer_reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL AND FUNCTIONAL
customer_reviews.text: I bought the black finish stovetop espresso maker in December 2019 and LOVE IT! Not only does it make excellent coffee but it's beautiful. After five months of daily use it is still beautiful. It's easy to use (just don't cover the valve inside with water) and easy to clean. So what if it's made in China? It's as well-made, if not better so than any I've had that were Italian.
customer_reviews.author: Judy C.

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and works very well.  Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I had read that aluminum Moka stovetop coffee makers heat up faster than stainless steel. We had previously used a one cup aluminum Bialetti. We can tell you that the stainless steel we purchased from Bialetti also, heats up faster than the aluminum and it has a larger capacity. It looks great and there is no fear of aluminum leaching into the coffee.
customer_reviews.author: genogeno

customer_reviews.title: Quality materials and craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Bialetti moka pot for a while but a friend freaked me out about the controversy of exposure to aluminium. I was looking for a new moka pot constructed of alternate materials and came across the Intenca. I was a little apprehensive of the quality because I had found another similar product for triple the price. I was relieved to find this is a very robust unit and and the styling is just as impressive in person. I've also found the brew quality to be equal to or better than my Bialetti. In my opinion moka pots extract the most flavor from coffee even when the roast is of questionable quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, skeptical at first, but worked well
customer_reviews.text: After visiting Europe, I really liked the Espresso style coffee. I had a Nespresso at home but got tired of all the used plastic cups those machines make and wanted to go for an overall cheaper option and settled on a Moka-style coffee maker. Now Im able to make my own pretty strong coffee, which is hard to do with a drip style machine, and which is pretty good in about 5-10 minutes or so. It looks nice but even more so, its really easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Taehwan Yoo

customer_reviews.title: Makes Great Tasting Coffee
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the materials and finish are very good, I prefer the stainless steel over aluminum in this type of espresso maker. A really nice feature that was not mentioned in the product description, the sealing gasket is made of high quality silicone that should last a very long time. My only criticism is that when you screw the top and bottom together, it is difficult to get it tight enough so that steam doesn't escape. I am finding that with repeated use it is becoming easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Ellen Calcagno

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this item, brews espresso extremely well with an extremely amazing taste, absolutely the best tasting espresso I've ever had. Cleans well, sturdy, can survive high heat and looks stylish. Nothing like thise cheapo versions you find at some stores. This one is truly built to last & tastes like I'm at a cafe in Italy. Buy it you wont regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Not aluminum. Makes the house smell great. Get it ready at night and it’s ready by the time I’m out of the shower. Cheaper than a machine and nothing will break. Company also sends a spare parts kit for free when you register (gasket and replacement filter) will recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Boswell

customer_reviews.title: It's worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: I went through 4 Primulas and each had a handle failure. I learned my lesson and got this instead. It is much better made, heavier stainless and just feels more like quality. Why does it make coffee that tastes better than the Primula? I have no idea, but it does. Very happy camper, who will be a deliriously happy camper if it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Rick J.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfaction Guaranteed!
customer_reviews.text: Not a year after we bought this lovely little pot the side gleam started flaking off and later the top welding came unattached. Otherwise Perfect Pot - Perfect cups of Espresso. When we contacted the maker they immediately said, "This is not up to our standards! Let us make it good for you." They shipped us a completely NEW espresso maker free of charge. There may be a bad batch roaming around there with these issues but Trust this Manufacturer! Reminds me of the old days when customer service was King.
customer_reviews.author: Answer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Update, Nov 7, great customer, emailed and the company respond back in couple of hours. They will replace the defective with a new one. Thanks Klaudia. Update. I bought this end of August 2019, after less than 3 months it is not working. The valve seems to be the problem. Before it took less the 7 mins to make coffee now it takes forever. Check out my video.
customer_reviews.author: Linus

customer_reviews.title: Induction-Compatible, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Review written after first use: the bonVIVO gleams, is well-made and, if you've ever made espresso, is intuitive. If you have never made espresso in a Mokka-like pot, it's easy: 3 part construction, add water and grinds, re-assemble and heat. On my induction cooktop, turned up to 10, the espresso was done in a minute and delivered to the foamed/frothed milk for my cappucino. Could not have asked for more.
customer_reviews.author: doctorbobster

customer_reviews.title: Awesome coffee and Espresso
customer_reviews.text: Makes amazing coffee/espresso. Love this thing. I have not used my coffee machine or press ever since I got this. After a couple of tries, I have the perfect ratio to make awesome Americano's, which is actually why I got it. WAY cheaper than an espresso machine. I used to go to Starbucks constantly, not any more. Mine are better! It is well built, realy easy to clean, much easier to work with than the coffee press. Make sure you get a size that is right for you. You must make the full capacity, don't get one that is too big and try to make a smaller amount. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: JaAWFam

customer_reviews.title: Bonvivo Customer Service is the benchmark that all customer service SHOULD BE!
customer_reviews.text: The fact that the bonVIVO Intenca Stovetop Espresso Maker is stainless steel is great versus the use of any aluminum cookware raising concerns about the potential hazards. Another plus for maker being all steel is that the handle is also steel. I've melted three plastic handles of other stovetop makers. bonVivo customer service is OUTSTANDING! They provide me with a FREE additional filter and gasket which I truly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Ann & Dave G.

customer_reviews.title: bonVIVO, Is An Excellent Espresso Coffee Maker.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the two- tone combination, Rose and stainless steel. Its beautiful!!! The problem is, after a week of used I notice the Rose color was peeling off, other wise is an exellent product, is made to last. If you are interest in purchase one get the stainless steel and problem solve, you wont be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Haydee Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Misleading! Not actually 5-6 cups!
customer_reviews.text: It says it makes 5-6 cups... that isn't literal cups, it's tiny espresso size cups. It only holds a little under 2 actual measured cups of water and yields a bit under 1.5 cups of coffee when all is said and done. I think I'll stick to my Aeropress.
customer_reviews.author: The Waites

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed...again
customer_reviews.text: Rust build up, so much for quality. I've had several issues including the peeling copper finish. My grandmother has had coffee makers similar to this from a 3rd world country that last her more than 5 years with none of these issues. Rust is harmful to ingest, and clearly there is a quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: stylish
customer_reviews.text: This is really a nice expresso coffee maker, well made and stylish. I use different coffee makers for how I want my coffee - and I really like this one - it will get a lot of use. I have a smaller style of by bonVIVO needed a larger one to speed up our caffeine intake - the copper and chrome looks really nice
customer_reviews.author: RPCV

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second moka pot. I returned the first one (Bialetti) because it felt cheap. This one does not. It feels substantial, so I’m not afraid to use it. The handle gets mildly hot - make sure to be careful until you know how much it heats up, but I don’t feel the need for a pot holder to use it. It comes apart smoothly once it’s cooled down. It cleans easily, and looks great on my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Carroll

customer_reviews.title: I’m glad that I didn’t read the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a be a Bialetti espresso maker. I prefer to use stainless steel over aluminum. When I did my research, I found that this had the best stainless steel grade. I appreciate the heft of the product. And, the design seems very nice too. I hope that I don’t have the same issue with the copper peeling. I’ve only had the espresso maker for under a week. The coffee has been excellent tasting. I will update my review if I find that the copper peels off. In the meantime, I’ve set a timer on the stove so that I don’t cook it too long. That’s what happened to my Bialetti.
customer_reviews.author: Portland Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to look at
customer_reviews.text: This works really well, but without the opportunity to contrast with a similar product, it is difficult to tell how good it is. However, here is what I can say anecdotally, guests have said the coffee is really good. In comparison to whatever else coffee they have had separately. I like the aesthetics of the product as well, but the chrome part of mine is plated and not real so it is already beginning to peel leaving behind the silver portion visible underneath. Would I recommend? 100% yes.
customer_reviews.author: Baba Agba

customer_reviews.title: Good quality works much better than others
customer_reviews.text: I originally but a cheaper one but sent it back b/c it was poor quality and leaked. This one is constructed much better and performs much better than other ones I’ve used. Save you self the hassle and frustration and get this one. I bought the chrome b/c of the one review where the copper finish came off. So far very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Proteus72

customer_reviews.title: Pretty
customer_reviews.text: It’s very pretty and small. It’s easy to clean and set up. However, I’m not sure if I received a used one. The bottom water chamber had a stark blended line as if it was used multiple times and left a “burned” mark. Maybe it’s the design? It just didn’t look too clean as I had hoped. It also doesn’t look like it’s stainless steel. Everything else does
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great cup of espresso quick and easy.
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is just like the tried and true Italian ones except it isn't aluminum - yeah!!! It is stainless and chrome. It is easy to use and clean. My only complaint is very minor. In the listing it is referred to as "copper" when it should be "copper-colored". Frankly, I wasn't surprised because if the upper portion were truly copper rather than copper-colored it would have been much more expensive. But in the interest of truth in advertising and full disclosure the listing should really be corrected to reflect the actual materials. Having said that, the copper-colored item is much easy to maintain and looks very nice with my real copper cookware.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle LaRoche

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for a coffee maker that’s easy to use and that makes rich but smooth tasting coffee I’d highly recommend this product. It has no moving parts unlike all French press coffee makers, so it will last much longer. I was so impressed I ordered another one for my twin brother.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Coe

customer_reviews.title: Adequate--but not great
customer_reviews.text: This product produces quick and okay tasting espresso. It is simple to use and--from what I can tell--easy to maintain. The output has something of the taste of espresso, but not as rich as from a traditional machine. Still, for a quick and dirty cup of espresso, it serves well.
customer_reviews.author: Steven PetersonTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I originally had an Bialetti which made fantastic coffee. The major drawback was it was aluminum and I was worried it would leach. So I tried the stainless steel and the coffee is great tasting and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: Best Stovetop Espresso I’ve had
customer_reviews.text: I’m a coffee aficionado. I have my coffee station at home. I own a Bodum pour over, a French press and 2 Nespresso machines. I always wanted an espresso machine but I don’t have enough space for one... then I saw the bonVIVO Intenca Stovetop Espreso Maker and started to compare it with other stovetop espresso makers. I learned that most of these type of espresso makers are made of aluminum. This was the main reason for me to buy the bonVIVO. It looks perfectly designed and works flawlessly. I love it so much that I also bought one for my sister as a gift. I know it’s a little pricey, but it’s worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: sharon gonzalez barbosa

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and groovy
customer_reviews.text: This espresso maker is very well constructed and slightly beautiful. It heats and brews quickly and I have not had a bad cup of java yet (and I've probably had too many). The handle is cool to grasp and the whole thing cleans with ease. Really, it makes a wonderful cup of espresso.
customer_reviews.author: MWx

customer_reviews.title: Saving me hundreds in yummy espresso
customer_reviews.text: LOVE. Quick and painless to make and clean, perfect espresso every time. Like pulling 6 shots without the repetitive action of tamping and pulling all those shots. I drink 4 in the AM and save the other 2 for afternoon lol. Making my home coffee routine so quick and seamless and delicious I'm not tempted to buy coffee drinks anymore. Grateful
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Bettinger

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a coffee lover and I enjoy a well made coffee. I’ve purchased many greka’s through out the years and the bonVIVO Inteca is the only that has proven to last (purchased my 1st one over 2years ago). That’s the reason I am bought my 2nd one and is the one I recommend to other friends.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I love the sleek design. I used it this morning twice. Makes strong enough coffee to turn it into a latte. I roast my own beans so it's always a treat to make a brew that really allows me to experience the flavor profile. Looking forward to more lattes from my kitchen in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Seabusicut

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best stovetop expresso maker I've owned. The price is well with the product. After every use and wash, the product still looks good as new. Brews the perfect coffee, and clean up is always a breeze. I've recommended this to every coffee lover I know.
customer_reviews.author: Michel

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee - but stick with the chrome finish
customer_reviews.text: I've owned both the chrome and the copper finishes. I liked the first one enough that I bought another one. After about two months of daily use and hand washing, the finish on the copper pot is chipping. If I have to get another one, it will be chrome.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I had this item insured. I need to call to have it replaced. Within a week of it being used the inside would not fit and the piece inside is not connected so it falls out.
customer_reviews.author: Dilenia Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Quality Stainless Steel Percolator
customer_reviews.text: I'm still playing around a bit with the texture of the coffee grounds to see what I like the best. This little percolator makes a nice strong cup of coffee, in pretty short order. It is solidly made, and I will update my review in a few months when I've used it quite a bit more, to see how it is holding up. I researched quite a few different manufacturers, and this seemed to be good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, no fuss, strong coffee/espresso
customer_reviews.text: Only just received it, so cannot really speak to durability, but it looks and feels very solid and well-made. Got absolutely great espresso/strong coffee on the very first attempt. I’m a little annoyed now that with a Moccamaster and Silvia sitting on my countertop, this $50 pot is probably the best, on an effort vs reward basis. Very pleased so far! Part the Deux: I have been using this pot more or less daily for several months, and it really holds up. The spare parts the manufacturer sends along for free are also a nice bonus. Very deserving of a five star rating in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made, modern looking and the perfect size for a big mug of latte. It is heavy stainless steel, not cheap aluminum. The handle appears to be attached very securely as well. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: annrki

customer_reviews.title: Great expresso maker
customer_reviews.text: I decided to purchase this after reading about possible links between aluminum and dementia since I was using an aluminum pot (better to be safe). It takes a little longer to make my coffee, which is just a difference in the type of metal, and my coffee comes out just as great. It's very nice looking and just as easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: vaquera_girl

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee
customer_reviews.text: My wife got this for me as a Christmas gift and I have been very pleased after 1 month of use. I really like how it can be used on a variety of cooking surfaces without being damaged. Good quality with the stainless steel. No rust or discoloration or metal shavings in my coffee...not sure what others are doing to their coffee maker to have such a negative experience. User error? Anyway, this makes great coffee if you follow the directions and start with a quality coffee - I buy from Black Rifle Coffee Company and always enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: John A

customer_reviews.title: Makes an excellent espresso!
customer_reviews.text: This espresso maker is an excellent alternative to the more expensive machines. It is big enough to make three small cappuccino's. It is easy to clean. We are happy! FYI Make sure to use good quality coffee like Lavazza and Illy ext.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.. worked well!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work just fine! Made a yummy cup of espresso.. I’m curious when I know when it runs out of water :/ like.. when a pan runs outta water and just scorches the pan. But it worked well and was easy to use.. once the apocalypse hits I’ll be one of few that can make espresso without electricity haha ;)
customer_reviews.author: stringpickin

customer_reviews.title: Tasty Coffee ☕️ 😀
customer_reviews.text: I tried my new bonVIVO espresso maker for the first time this morning and my coffee tasted AMAZING!!! I’m not the type to even write reviews, but I have to say there was a noticeable difference in flavor. I have been using a stovetop espresso maker for years, and decided it was time for a new one, with a larger capacity so I “ Basically, I bought it because I thought it looked really cool. I thought all espresso makers were created equal, but I had no idea!! Not only does this look really nice sitting on the stove, it makes an amazingly flavorful and smooth cup of espresso. I’m very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Oversteg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Espress!
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy another Moka pot, as I had mine for many years and it made delicious expresso. However, I am very happy with this stainless steel Moka pot. It is beautiful and delivers a great cup of coffee. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ida N. Zecco

customer_reviews.title: Did not bring water completely up to completely make coffee and the peeling
customer_reviews.text: Did not bring up the water all the way up. Coffee grinds got stuck . And the copper on the outside top of coffee maker peeling continue.
customer_reviews.author: Viviane

customer_reviews.title: Copper color peels off and rust forms inside the water well.
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of proper cleaning, oxidation occurs inside causing rust as the base is a heavy iron. The tankard with handle are pretty but the copper color peels right off when washed. It does the job, yes, but I would agree that customers want a beautiful product that lasts and this is not that. It could be. Then, perhaps, more people would buy this and be satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Heater

customer_reviews.title: In love with this espresso maker!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stovetop coffee maker makes enough coffee for 4 lates or 4 espresso shots. I have been using it daily for our afternoon coffee. A must have for coffee lovers and it’s so pretty to look at ❤️
customer_reviews.author: yas

customer_reviews.title: Quality product that makes excellent espresso
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Bonvivo moka pot for almost two months now. Rarely a day goes by that I don't use it. I can make impressive tasting espresso based drinks for just a few cents versus $4-5 at a coffee shop. I am so happy with this purchase that I have told my friends about it, and have even made them some of their favorite coffee drinks. They, too, have been very impressed with the taste. Honestly, one of the best purchases I've ever made on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Espresso on stovetop
customer_reviews.text: Used twice now- nice to have a small stove top version instead of some big machine. Makes 2 1/2 cup regular coffee cup size of espresso. Very tasty and easy to use. Seems well made & sturdy- happy it's SS. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer S frlm MN

customer_reviews.title: Careful! This pot can burn your hand.
customer_reviews.text: Copper finish comes off in the dishwasher after just a handful of uses. Design is attractive, but one can easily burn their hand removing the pot or checking the contents due to its all metal construction. Hard to seal properly. Espresso spews from the center at times.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: The best of all of them!
customer_reviews.text: I have had many, many coffee makers over the years. For espresso, I found this to be the best for looks, ease of use, and production of great coffee. It's built so well, it could be the last espresso pot I ever purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Iva Biggun

customer_reviews.title: Quick, easy, delicious espresso!
customer_reviews.text: I love this Espresso maker! It is beautiful, and brews coffee in about 6 minutes on my stovetop. I am impressed with the construction and the ease of cleaning. I also love that it is stainless steel, NOT aluminum, like many others. Very impressed. I own a Bialetti moka pot as well, and I like this one so much better. I would buy another, and especially a larger one for making espresso for guests.
customer_reviews.author: JEDavis

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice and heavy duty. I have only used a few times but it is easy to use. I am switching to this from espresso machine, so it makes something different than machine espresso, but this is a solid coffee. Reminds me of Croatia- sitting at the cafes with a shot of Italian coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Best espresso maker ever what else to say!
customer_reviews.text: The quality is way better than other aluminum models. I believe the shot actually taste better as well! This is the best espresso purchase I have made in the last 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Good for about two espressos at a time.
customer_reviews.text: I received the product last week and can say that I am very happy with the quality of the coffee maker and the looks of it. It is very sturdy stainless stelle and has a beautiful chrome finish to it. It is also very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Alex R.

customer_reviews.title: Decent option for a percolator
customer_reviews.text: Pros, heavy, thick base that will last! Cons, the handle and flap on the lid are metal which means they get hotter than is comfortable Aside of this, I think it's a good quality, but needs some tweaking on the design.
customer_reviews.author: PrettyWitty1
